title: Umbrella Academy season 2 'coming soon' says Netflix: What to expect
text:
Here’s everything you can expect from the new season (Picture: Getty – Netflix UK)

**Spoilers for The Umbrella Academy season one below**

Filming for Netflix’s The Umbrella Academy season two is firmly under way in Toronto and fans are scouring the web for information about the show, based on a comic series created by My Chemical Romance’s Gerard Way.

Netflix recently teased fans with the upcoming series by uploading an Instagram photo of the cast with the caption: ‘just some good eggs taking a family selfie. Umbrella Academy s2 is coming soon ☂️.’

The show burst on to screens earlier this year and swiftly gained a huge and loyal fanbase, as a staggering 45 million viewers tuned into the show in its first month streaming on Netflix.

Season two is set to be one of the streaming giant’s most anticipated releases when it comes out next year, but until that time, there’s one overarching question on every fan’s minds (this one included) – what on Earth (or off Earth, really) happens next?

Recap

Dedicated viewers of the show will remember The Umbrella Academy ended on the mother of all cliffhangers.

Our favourite antiheroes escaped their crumbling home as their sibling Vanya destroyed their mansion, with Diego saved from the falling debris by Ben whilst Five got drawn into meeting The Handler at a motel – which turned out to be a distraction.

Season one ended on a rough note (Picture: Netflix)

The siblings escaped and headed to The Icarus Theatre, where Vanya planned to destroy the world, and whilst Allison managed to incapacitate Vanya, it was too late, and her energy destroyed the moon.

This of course kick-started the destruction of Earth – which was what the siblings had been tasked with preventing in the first place.

Faced with the destruction of his world, Five suggested they use their abilities to travel back in time to stop the Apocalypse as a team.

Vanya had no idea of what she was able to do (Picture: Netflix)

Cue cliffhanger ending.

What’s the cast saying about season 2?

Firstly, all the Hargreeves kids will be back; Vanya (Ellen Page), Luther (Tom Hopper), Klaus (Robert Sheehan), Allison (Emmy Raver-Lampman), Diego (David Castaneda), Number Five (Aidan Gallagher) and Ben (Ethan Hwang).

Tom Hopper, who plays Luther Hargreeves, has suggested that time travel is likely to be an important theme in the upcoming new season.

Speaking to Den of Geek, he said: ‘With this show that’s a huge question ‘cause we could go in so many different directions.

‘And yeah, the time travel element is gonna be a huge one. Where we are and then what we do in that time period remains to be seen.’

If they go back in time, will they be teenagers again? (Picture: Netflix)

There will be more of Vanya, according to Page. She told the publication: ‘For me, it’s going be so interesting to explore Vanya. It’s like Vanya 2.0 – less repressed and what does that mean in the good ways and bad kinda thing.’

Advertisement

And if the ‘murmurings are to be believed,’ said Robert Sheehan, who plays Klaus, his character will change completely.

‘He’s [Klaus] constantly emerging into this new self. He’s a butterfly that refuses to leave the cocoon, or he keeps going back into it.

Will Klaus come to terms with his troubling power? (Picture: Netflix)

‘I’d love to see Klaus re-formed as something else, different completely. Hopefully, if the murmurings are to be believed, that’s kind of where we’re headed.’

Cameron Britton, who plays Hazel, said the cast are just as much in the dark about it as fans: ‘There are so many questions of what happens next but [showrunner] Steve Blackman’s being horrible and won’t tell me about it.’

Theories

It is likely that the kids’ adoptive father Sir Reginald Hargeeves will return, if in no other form other than flashbacks – as he did in the first season– especially given Klaus’s ability to summon the dead.

Mary J Blige plays a hilarious assassin (Picture: Netflix)

Hazel and Cha-Cha (Mary J Blige) may also return as the idiosyncratic time-travelling assassin duo, though it remains to be seen how that will happen given Cha-Cha was vaporised as chunks of moon rained down on Earth.

If showrunners dip into the Dallas volume of the comics, they may be taken to an alternate universe where John F Kennedy was never assassinated and the Lincoln monument is on a rampage (yes, really.)

If they dip into Hotel Oblivion, the show will have the siblings dealing with their father’s most troubling creation: the Hotel Oblivion, an Arkham Asylum-style institution where Hargreeves sent the villains that his children captured.

We want Ben back from the dead (Picture: Netflix)

It may well be that, like season one, season two will dip into a bit of both whilst ultimately creating a new narrative.

Advertisement

What does the Umbrella Academy comic book say?

With little to go on in terms of spoilers, we have to look to the comic books by Gerard Way and Gabriel Ba for plot theories.

Way and Ba have written three volumes of The Umbrella Academy – Apocalypse Suite, Dallas and Hotel Oblivion.

Once more for the people at the back: We. Want. Ben (Picture: Instagram)

There are elements of Apocalyse Suite in season one, so it stands to reason that there may be elements of Dallas and/or Hotel Oblivion in the second season.

‘The goal for us is to stay ahead of the show,’ Way told Digital Spy, ‘and since we’re on series three [of the comics], we are now ahead of the show. So that’s a good thing.

‘The idea with the comic is to go right from series three, take a three-to-four-month break, then go right into series four. That is kind of our schedule to keep us on track. So there is story there and it’s all planned out.’

New cast members

Netflix has revealed three new additions for the second season – exciting stuff.

Joining the second season will be new cast member Rit Arya, of Humans ilk as character Lila, who is described as a ‘chameleon who can be as brilliant or as clinically insane as the situation requires’ – standard.

Yusuf Gatewood (Good Omens) is also joining the ranks as Raymond, who is a ‘born leader with the smarts, gravitas, and the confidence to never have to prove it to anyone’ and has the ability to ‘disarm you with a look.’

Advertisement

Marin Ireland plays Sissy, who is described as a ‘fearless, no-nonsense Texas mom [sic] who married young for all the wrong reasons.’

Ritu Arya, Yusuf Gatewood and Marin Ireland (Picture: Getty)

A group of misfits joining a group of misfits? Sounds about right.

None of the new characters are from the original comic, prompting fans to wonder how far season two will deviate from the source material.

What do we want to happen?

We’ve written an extensive list of all our requirements for season two, so listen up Umbrella Academy folks.

Among other things, we want Luther and Allison to figure out whether their love story will be more Romeo and Juliet or Taming of the Shrew.

We also want to see more of the people born with supernatural powers at the same time as the Hargreeves. That’s 36 different potential superpowers that are just waiting to be discovered.

Also, we want Ben to come back from the dead. Please.

The Umbrella Academy season two is expected for release on Netflix in 2020.
